data.event: It was founded in 1829 and named after President Andrew Jackson.
On July 3, 1829, Horace Blackman, accompanied by Alexander Laverty, a land surveyor, and an Indian guide forded the Grand River and made camp for the night at what is now Trail and N. Jackson Street.

event.title: forded the Grand River and made camp for the night at what is now

data.event: On July 3, 1829, Horace Blackman, accompanied by Alexander Laverty, a land surveyor, and an Indian guide forded the Grand River and made camp for the night at what is now Trail and N. Jackson Street.
Blackman returned to Jackson in August 1829, with his brother Russell.
Finally, in 1838 the town's name was changed to simply Jackson.
